name: Day of Defeat
description: Enlist in an intense brand of Axis vs. Allied teamplay set in the WWII European Theatre of Operations. Players assume the role of light/assault/heavy infantry, sniper or machine-gunner class, each with a unique arsenal of historical weaponry at their disposal. Missions are based on key historical operations.
minimum_requirements: 500 mhz processor, 96mb ram, 16mb video card, Windows XP, Mouse, Keyboard, Internet Connection Recommended: 800 mhz processor, 128mb ram, 32mb+ video card, Windows XP, Mouse, Keyboard, Internet Connection

reviews.review_text: Bloody frusterating as all hell. Why? Walking through an ally way with team mates, at least four Im at the front, theres a machine gun at the exit and I can't get out. Suddenly, team mates all decide the best course of action is to throw  their grenades out of the exit in an effortless hope to kill the gunner. They all miss horribly.  Allyway is filled with grenades, I turn around and start screaming maniacally while the rest of the team says 'GO FORWARD DUMBASS' I sprint out of the allyway at mach speed, get gunned down, the rest of the team gets blown out of the allyway by the force of a thousand  suns into one big pile of clipping corpses in front of this mortified machine gunner who just witnissed the first friendly fire induced holocaust. The gunner siezes this fnck-up and takes advantage of our major failure. He pushes up into the allyway where all of us, again,  try to have another go at it. This time, im not first. someone else is. The first guy sprints into the allyway and is gunned down. I decide to  throw a grenade which promptly kills the machine gunner and I run  into the ally. My ♥♥♥-backwards sorry sh!t-for-brain team mates  don't read the bloody kill feed and throw grenades at me, thinking  the machine gunner is still there. I scream 'GUYS WHAT THE HELL, IT'S CLEAR, DON'T THROW GRENADES' but apparently all they heard was 'IT'S CLEAR', because they all came sprinting into the allyway practically slipping on their own grenades like mario kart banana peels, and the grenades vaporize our asses clean off.   The game is pretty good. 10/10
Never was into writing reviews but i love this game and i have owned since 2003 and now is better than never so here :D Great Game with great graphics :P Fun game
This games got hitboxes bigger than your momma 10/10
Great game. It's a shame people try to cheat years ater the game first came out though.

Day of Defeat is one of my personal all time favorite games.  This game takes the fun of Counter Strike and adds flag captures for the most part. It is a quicker deathmatch with control points game that may limit you more on weapons as you don't buy from a list but has many available mods and custom maps to improve your expierence.

Despite it's age, ''Day of Defeat'' is still alive and doing well. A lot of the players are non-Steam, so the charts are only correct for the Steam users. It's a WW2 shooter with realism. It is very hard to get into this game since it has a big learning curve and pretty much everyone is extremely good. Most of the maps are very well made and balanced. There are a few narrow maps which are a slaughterhouse if there are too many players though. I believe that there are things you should know before playing this game, so here are a few words of advice:   - Grenades are very powerful - Grenades are detonated quicker if you pull the pin and do not throw it for a while  - Most Grenadier and Sniper shots will be a one shot kill  - In narrow maps it will be very frustrating, so play on larger maps first  - Automatic weapons have recoil which is very hard to handle, so take your time to learn the basics of each weapon  - Constantly check the map to see if you have teammates around, so you know if it's safe to push  - You will die. A LOT.  That's pretty much it. Things like spots, weapons, maps and tricks you will learn along the way of playing it. First few hours will be very frustrating, especially for someone who hasn't played realistic shooters, but you will find yourself scoring more and more kills over time and it will be very satisfying. So, give this game a shot even if at first glance you think that the game is bad or everyone is too good or cheating. It is one of the best WW2/Realism games I've played for sure.

Back when my Mom and Dad were in their late twenties they used to play the classic Steam games like Deathmatch Classic, Team Fortress Classic, Counter-Strike, Half-Life, and Day of Defeat which is the game I'm reviewing now. Same scenario as my Deathmatch Classic review, I was on my Dad's old Steam account and I saw Day of Defeat on it and when I was really little I used love The Military and World War II so this game was so fun to play when I was young. Now I'm not into the army anymore but this game is still very fun to play plus it brings me back to when I was a young chap.
This game is worth every moment ive wasted playing it. No regrets here. Still has a community of players during the week and even more during the weekend. Buy it, you wont regret it

In my opinion, everyone should have this in their library, because there are many reasons why, but i'll give you two: 1. It's one of the best and the most realistic WW2 shooters out there. 2.It's a classic title and there are alot of servers active, that means that you can play this every time! Recommend this to your friends to support this game and to keep it alive like the other classic titles(Team Fortress Classic, Deathmatch Classic, etc).

DOD irresistibly draws you back for more time and time again. The level designs shine above so many other team-based shooters and provide the perfect stage for some unbeatably tense shootouts.The sound of bullets whizzing past your ear or slamming into some nearby surface is disturbingly realistic.
Definitely a good game, well balanced weapons and great mechanics. Could spend hours on end playing.

I bought this game because I had a little bit of money which I didn't know what to spend it on, and I can say it was a great £3.49 I have spent.   It is sort of like Red Orchestra 2, but less buggy. You can be in a great amount of teams, and there are lots of guns etc to choose from.  Teams: Britain Germany America  I only played a few games, but it was enjoyable. It certainly isn't the best game I have played, but it deffinetly isn't the worst either. I would recommend this game, it's worth the price and good to mess around in.

Whether looking for an old game to play to remember the days before steam, or because nothing else will work on your computer, this is an ok buy, but only if on sale.  The original Day of Defeat, graphics wise, looks like ♥♥♥♥. Half life, CS 1.6 and TFC look far better than this, and they are much older. Trees, Barbed wire, and various vegetation textures are glitched, and will somtimes not be transparent as they should be. effects are also, unreasonably crappy, as grenades do not show an actual explosion, unlike most older HL games (keep in mind this game runs on another engine, though), and gun fire creates and unjustifiably large, half-♥♥♥♥♥ light effect.  Gameplay is not terrible, though certain effects form jumping, running, and going prone can be annoying. There are many diverse classes with unique weapons, and sometimes even map specific weapons and gamemodes. Most maps are conquest, while some are search and destroy. Unlike CS there is respawning, but on wave timers. Controls are ok on default, but I would recommend some custumization, as some keys, like flashlight, are stupidly placed (it's 'n'). Some maps are poorly lit, quite a few are unnecessarily large, and most are designed so that the battles of WW2 end up more like WW1. A bloody stalemate in the middle of the map that shifts forward occaisionally, only to be stopped by someone in a bottleneck with an MG.  While there is still a community, there are alot of empty servers, so lukily there are mods for bots. While playing can be pretty frustrating at times, it's still a fun game to play, and is far better than it's source counterpart. Get it during a sale.

Listen. This game has to be one of the poopiest flawking game i've ever played. Only kidding haha, this game really brings vibes of the world wars and shows accurate representation of history. I've actually been able to complete many history projects because of this game. It also helps me with my german course in elementary school since the game provides translations of the german language. 10/10 video game, hopefully everyone gets a chance to play this game.

I really like this game, like really. First got into it when a PCGamer Magazine featured beta 1.3 in one of their CDRoms that came with the magazine, back in 2001 I think. Stopped playing for a while in the middle of the decade, picked it up again a few years ago, and have been playing pretty regularly.  For new players, a little advice, please change your name before entering your first game. Communication is key, don't get sniped and neglect to tell your team where the sniper is.  Do not sit in one spot for too long. Some of these guys have been playing since before you were born and can hit any spot on the map. Crouch and shoot unless you're caught unawares, then make yourself a moving target and aim for the head. Stay in cover, but if you kill someone move your position, good teams communicate. Don't take the mg to the top of the bank on Caen or to either sniper loft, you will die very fast.   Learn to snipe on your feet, laying down and sniping is the worst. Try to vary your routine, if you choose the same route too often, experienced players will learn to anticipate you. When sniping an exit from the side, place your crosshair a few feet in front of the exit to give yourself enough space to shoot a streaking opposing player exiting.   Throw your nades on the ground and pick them up, hold them for a sec and then throw them [holding time will vary].   If you use an automatic weapon, aim at center mass and quickly streak up to the head. When walking let your crosshairs naturally rest in a slightly elevated position, that way if you suddenly come upon an enemy, you will likely already be aiming at his head [beware, pros will crouch to avoid this very thing [ofc they'll also jump to avoid your shot, idk do your best]]. Fire in short bursts. Change your crosshairs to dynamic instead of static.   Have fun. This game is great, there is a core community left that is mostly polite and old. But there is still some young blood, like me and others. Try out the Merrill's Marauder's 24/7 Caen and Avalanche servers. They are consistently full and well administrated. I'm usually on in the afternoon/night. GG.

Another fun FPS game that takes place during WWII. You get to play as either Allied or Axis, and you have to capture all the areas of a point in order to win a round, similar to a type of gameplay found in Team Fortress 2.  Pros: Ability to play both sides Great graphics, love the scenery in some levels, like the train station level Teams are balanced Combat is good Gameplay is addicting  Cons: The aiming for machine guns are kinda awkward as the gun moves upward when you fire, and you have to quickly reorient yourself and/or you could get killed while doing so. The game is really hard when you first play it, but it becomes really fun and enjoyable once you get used to it and keep playing it; I guarantee ones who start to play it will want to keep playing.  I recommend this great game :D

Honestly if you asked me today I couldnt tell you if DoD or DoD:S is better. Both have great features, linux support, and of course awesome gameplay.  Since both of the DoD titles rock, I'll make a pros list rather than a pros/cons list for the original DoD:  -Many classes for lots of variety in playstyles. -A pretty nice hud. -Awesome servers. -Good graphics for GoldSrc. -Nice sound quality. -Great price(I'd still get it in CS1 Anthology though). -Balanced weapons. -WW2 themed.  Yeah, I love this game.

I remember when i first got this game, it came with a bundle of Counter Strike: Source and Half Life 2 Deathmatch. I spent hours on it since i was 7 and i dont regret a single minute. Okay so lets talk about cons and pros.  Pros: + Big maps- feels like bigger scaled COD WW2 maps.  + Graphics- for the time when it was released they are awesome, detailed textures of guns, troops tanks and such.  + Community- you will never see a little annoying kido`s playing this game since the community is 20+ year olds (thats why sometimes i prefer playing this rather than CS:GO).  + Price- it is worth it even without the sale, since there are cool mods like Gun Game. Zombies and many other cool games.  + Engine- well the game is obviously works on source, but there are major differences between other Valve FPS games. Recoil is absolutely crazy, you cant just sprint and just put a whole clip into someone, even when you are crouching the recoil is less but still hard to control. (which i find more interesting to play and experiment with) This game is not for ragequiters and easily frustrated people.  +\- Weaponry- since 2006-2007 the new patch removed some content as well with Brittish weaponry and teams, (since then its only Axis vs Allies). And still there is a decent amount of weapons considering its just a simple DM game.  Cons;  - Community- Each month less and less people play this game, idk why but it happens. But there are still like 30+ servers with classic DoD communtiy which i find enjoyable to play on.  Conclusion: I cant really find something bad to tell about this game.  My rating is 10/10 since its the best fps multiplayer game on Steam. (a lot of people may disagree with me and i respect your opinion).
